term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - limit of detection in analysis
term.title: limit of detection

item.text: The limit of detection, expressed as the concentration, cL, or the quantity, q L, is derived from the smallest measure, x L, that can be detected with reasonable certainty for a given analytical procedure. The value of x L is given by the equation x L = x ̄ bi + k s bi is the mean of the blank measures, s bi is the standard deviation of the blank measures, and k is a numerical factor chosen according to the confidence level desired.

item.alttext: x L = x ̄ bi + k s bi
